newsitem.title: USA: Dataflex to sell East, Midwest operations.
newsitem.headline: Dataflex to sell East, Midwest operations.

text.p: Dataflex Corp said on Monday that it would sell its Eastern and Midwestern operations for $50 million to AmeriData Technologies Inc , a GE Capital Technology Management Services Company.
All sales and operations of the Edison, N.J., New York City, N.Y., Chicago, Ill., and Milwaukee, Wis. locations would become part of AmeriData. The operations have combined revenues of $175 million.
Dataflex said it would focus on growing revenues and profits in the Southeast.

The company said it expects to realize an after-tax loss of $1.3 million on this transaction. Following the transaction, Dataflex will have revenues of $160 million and net worth of $30 million or $5.50 per share.
Dataflex said the sale is consistent with its plan to reduce debt and improve its balance sheet. -- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610.
